## Graph info
::: {style="font-size: 1.25em; color: #38B44A;"}
**When would I use this graph?**
:::

<br>

```{r}
#| label: full_code_display
#| eval: true
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '60%'
#| out-width: '60%'
#| fig-align: right
library(ggplot2movies) 
library(ggplot2)
movies_sum_col <- ggplot2movies::movies |>
    filter(!is.na(budget) & mpaa != "") |>
    select(budget, mpaa) |>
    group_by(mpaa) |>
    summarise(avg_budget = mean(budget, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
    ungroup()
labs_col <- labs(
  title = "IMDB movie information/user ratings",
  x = "MPAA rating", 
  y = "Average budget in US dollars")
ggp2_col <- ggplot(data = movies_sum_col,
              aes(x = mpaa, 
                  y = avg_budget)) + 
        geom_col(aes(fill = mpaa), 
          show.legend = FALSE) + 
        scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::dollar) 
ggp2_col + 
  labs_col
```

`geom_col()` allows us to display summary statistics for a numerical variable across levels of a categorical variable.

Remove the missing values and reduce the `ggplot2movies::movies` dataset to only `budget` and `mpaa`, then group the data by `mpaa` and calculate the mean `budget` (as `avg_budget`).

```{r}

    filter(!is.na(budget) & mpaa != "") |>
    select(budget, mpaa) |>
    group_by(mpaa) |>
    summarise(avg_budget = mean(budget, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
    ungroup()
```

### Code

::: {style="font-size: 0.90em; color: #1e83c8;"}
**CODE:**
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}

Create labels

Map `mpaa` to the `x` and `avg_budget` to the `y`

Map `mpaa` to `fill` inside the `aes()` of `geom_col()` and remove the legend with `show.lengend = FALSE`

Format the `y` axis with `scale_y_continuous()` by setting labels to `scales::dollar`

:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: code_graph_sum_col
#| eval: false
#| echo: true 
#| warning: false
#| message: false
labs_col <- labs(
  title = "IMDB movie information/user ratings",
  x = "MPAA rating", 
  y = "Average budget in US dollars")
ggp2_col <- ggplot(data = movies_sum_col,
              aes(x = mpaa, 
                  y = avg_budget)) + 
        geom_col(aes(fill = mpaa), 
          show.legend = FALSE) + 
        scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::dollar) 
ggp2_col + 
  labs_col
```
